bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite subsections (1) to (5), if the amount of assistance for which a family unit is eligible for a benefit month is less than

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the applicable amount in respect of the family unit's supplement under section 54.2 [persons with disabilities transportation supplement], plus
the minimum amount to be deducted under this section,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the minimum amount that is to be deducted for the purposes of section 19 (1) (b) of the Act for the benefit month is an amount that is equal to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the amount of assistance for which the family unit is eligible for the benefit month, minus
the applicable amount in respect of the family unit's supplement under section 54.2 [persons with disabilities transportation supplement].

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite subsections (4) (a) and (5) (a), if the conviction referred to in those subsections occurred before the date this section came into force, a deduction under subsection (4) or (5) begins for the first benefit month following the date this section came into force.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exemptions from deductions for debts owed

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 270/2019, App. 2, s. 20 (a).]
Section 74 (2) does not apply to a family unit for a benefit month if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the family unit receives disability assistance under section 8 (2) (b) [people in special care] of Schedule A for the benefit month, or
section 74 (2.1) or (3) applies to the family unit for that benefit month.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 74 (2.1) does not apply to a family unit for a benefit month if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the family unit receives disability assistance under section 8 (2) (b) of Schedule A for the benefit month, or
section 74 (3) applies to the family unit for that benefit month.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 74 (3) does not apply to a family unit for a benefit month if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the family unit receives disability assistance under section 8 (2) (b) of Schedule A for the benefit month,
the minister is satisfied that the family unit is homeless or at risk of becoming homeless,
the minister is satisfied that a deduction under that section would result in danger to the health of a person in the family unit, or

a recipient in the family unit is liable for an offence overpayment but the person convicted of the criminal code offence or Act offence that resulted in the offence overpayment is not a member of the family unit for the benefit month.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite section 74 (2), (2.1) and (3), a deduction under section 19 (1) (b) of the Act may not be made from a supplement under Division 7 [Housing Stability Supplement] of Part 5.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Recovery of more than one type of debt

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (2) applies if the minister is entitled to recover more than one of the following types of debt in respect of a family unit or a recipient in a family unit:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: overpayments under section 74 (2);
deposit debts under section 74 (2.1);
offence overpayments under section 74 (3).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may recover the debts referred to in subsection (1) from the family unit or recipient in the family unit, as applicable, by

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: making a deduction respecting only one of the types of debt per benefit month, and
making the deduction in accordance with the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if the minister is entitled to recover debt as set out in subsection (1) (a), (b) and (c), subsection (1) (a) and (c) or subsection (1) (b) and (c), by deducting the amount set out in section 74 (3) until the total debt the minister is entitled to recover under section 74 (3) is fully recovered;

if the minister is entitled to recover debt as set out in subsection (1) (a) and (b), by deducting the amount set out in section 74 (2.1) until the total debt the minister is entitled to recover under section 74 (2.1) is fully recovered.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed enactments for purposes of sections 19 (1) (b) and 20 (2) [no garnishment, attachment, execution or seizure] of the Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: The following Acts are prescribed:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for the purposes of section 19 (1) (b) of the Act, the Employment and Assistance Act;
for the purposes of section 20 (2) of the Act, the Employment and Assistance Act.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The minister may provide

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: disability assistance or hardship assistance to or for a recipient by cheque or electronic funds transfer or in vouchers or in kind, and
a supplement to or for a recipient by cheque or electronic funds transfer or in vouchers or in kind.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 8/2006, s. (b).]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Replacement of lost or stolen assistance cheque
bcl:section.bcl:text: If satisfied that an unendorsed assistance cheque has been lost or stolen, the minister may issue a replacement as long as,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of theft, the matter has been reported to police, and
in the case of loss or theft, the recipient

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: makes a declaration of the facts, and
undertakes to promptly deliver the lost or stolen cheque to the minister if it is recovered.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition in respect of the change to asset limits
bcl:section.bcl:text: Despite any repeal and replacement of section 6 (1) (b) and (2) (b) of the Disability Benefits Program Regulation, B.C. Reg. 79/97, section 6 (1) (b) and (2) (b) of the Disability Benefits Program Regulation as it read on March 31, 2002, applies to the family unit of a recipient until the date the person's eligibility is next audited under section 30 [requirement for eligibility audit].

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition in respect of repealed provisions

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, repealed provision means section 18, 19 or 20 (2) (a) or (g) of the Disability Benefits Program Regulation, B.C. Reg. 79/97, in force on March 31, 2002.
The minister must not provide assistance authorized under a repealed provision except an amount awarded on an appeal in respect of a calendar month prior to April, 2002.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transitional benefit to attend mental health activity centre
bcl:section.bcl:text: The minister may continue to provide a family unit with an amount that, immediately before this section comes into force, the family unit was receiving as a travel allowance under section 75 (1) of the Income Assistance Regulation, B.C. Reg. 75/97, to enable a person in the family unit to attend a mental health activity centre.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the family unit includes one or more dependent children or deemed dependent children, the support allowance under subsection (1) for a calendar month is increased by an amount equal to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the total BC child adjustment amount for all dependent children and all deemed dependent children in the family unit, minus
the sum of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the family bonus, if any, paid to the family unit for the preceding month,

the Canada child benefit, if any, paid to the family unit for the preceding month in respect of dependent children in the family unit, up to a maximum of the BC child adjustment amount in respect of those dependent children, and

the total amount of the supplements, if any, provided to or for the family unit under section 59 [supplement for delayed, suspended or cancelled family bonus] or 59.1 [supplement for delayed, suspended or cancelled Canada child benefit] of this regulation for the current calendar month.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the amount calculated under subsection (2) is less than zero, it is deemed to be zero for the purposes of this section.

In calculating the adjustment under subsection (2), an amount that, under the Income Tax Act (British Columbia) or the Income Tax Act (Canada), is deducted or set off from the family bonus or the Canada child benefit must be treated as if it were paid to a person in the family unit.
The support allowance under subsection (1) for a calendar month is not increased under subsection (2) if a person in the family unit refuses to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: apply for the family bonus or the Canada child benefit for the preceding calendar month, or
accept the family bonus or the Canada child benefit for the preceding calendar month

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: in respect of a dependent child in the family unit who is, or may be, a qualified dependant within the meaning of the Income Tax Act (Canada).
If a family unit includes a person who

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: immediately before reaching 19 years of age was a dependent child in the family unit, and
reached that age while attending secondary school,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the person is deemed to be a dependent child, for the purposes of this section, until the earlier of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the end of the school year in which the person reached the age of 19 years, and
the date the person stops attending secondary school.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of this section, if the family unit includes a deemed dependent child, the BC child adjustment amount applies in respect of the deemed dependent child as if the deemed dependent child was a dependent child.

bcl:section.bcl:text: In the calendar month that contains the disability assistance application date, the monthly support allowance is prorated based on the number of days remaining in that calendar month, beginning with the date of that submission.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: How actual shelter costs are calculated

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purpose of this section, utility costs for a family unit's place of residence include only the following costs:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: fuel for heating;
fuel for cooking meals;
water;
hydro;
garbage disposal provided by a company on a regular weekly or biweekly basis;
rental of one basic residential single-line telephone.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: When calculating the actual monthly shelter costs of a family unit, only the following items are included:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: rent for the family unit's place of residence;
mortgage payments on the family unit's place of residence, if owned by a person in the family unit;
a house insurance premium for the family unit's place of residence if owned by a person in the family unit;
property taxes for the family unit's place of residence if owned by a person in the family unit;
utility costs;
the actual cost of maintenance and repairs for the family unit's place of residence if owned by a person in the family unit and if these costs have received the minister's prior approval.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If utility costs fluctuate, they may be averaged over the periods

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: beginning on October 1 and ending on March 31, and
beginning on April 1 and ending on September 30.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If 2 or more family units share the same place of residence, the actual shelter costs of any one of them are the smaller of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the amount calculated by

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: dividing the actual shelter costs for all the family units by the number of persons occupying that place of residence, and
multiplying the result by the number of persons in that one family unit, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the amount declared by the family unit as the shelter costs for that family unit.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: base amount means

bcl:definition.bcl:text: initial qualifying month, in respect of a family unit and a calendar year, means the calendar month specified for the family unit under subsection (5);
qualifying income means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: earned income, except the deductions permitted under section 2, and
unearned income that is compensation paid under section 191 [temporary total disability] or 192 [temporary partial disability] of the Workers Compensation Act;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: qualifying month, in respect of a family unit and a calendar year, means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the initial qualifying month for the family unit in the calendar year, and
any subsequent calendar month in the calendar year that is a calendar month for which the family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance under the Act;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: recognized family unit, in respect of a calendar year, means a family unit that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: forms during the calendar year, and
includes at least one person who

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is designated as a person with disabilities, and
was previously a recipient in another family unit that was eligible to receive disability assistance under the Act for a calendar month in the calendar year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 1 (c) and (d), the lesser of the following amounts is exempt income of a family unit for a qualifying month:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the qualifying income of the family unit for the qualifying month;
the exemption limit of the family unit for the qualifying month calculated in accordance with subsection (3).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The exemption limit of a family unit for a qualifying month for the family unit in a calendar year is the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of the initial qualifying month for the family unit in the calendar year, the amount calculated in accordance with subsection (4);
in the case of any other qualifying month for the family unit in the calendar year, the amount calculated in accordance with subsection (7).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (3) (a), the exemption limit of a family unit for the initial qualifying month for the family unit in a calendar year is calculated as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a family unit other than a recognized family unit, the exemption limit is the product of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the base amount for the family unit, and
12 minus the number of calendar months in the calendar year that are before that initial qualifying month;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a recognized family unit that includes only one recipient, the exemption limit is the product of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the base amount for the recognized family unit, and
12 minus the number of calendar months in the calendar year that are before that initial qualifying month;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a recognized family unit that includes two recipients, the exemption limit is the sum of the carryover amounts for the recipients calculated in accordance with subsection (6).

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the first calendar month for which the family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance under the Act, if

bcl:clause.bcl:text: a member of the family unit who is designated as a person with disabilities previously received disability assistance under the Act or a former Act, as a person with disabilities, or
a member of the family unit received income assistance under the Employment and Assistance Act for the calendar month immediately preceding that first calendar month, or

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if subparagraph (i) does not apply, the first calendar month, after the first calendar month referred to in that subparagraph, for which the family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance under the Act;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a family unit described in subsection (4) (b), the initial qualifying month is the first calendar month, after the calendar month in which the family unit forms, for which the family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance under the Act;
in the case of a family unit described in subsection (4) (c), the initial qualifying month is

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the calendar month in which the family unit forms, if the family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance under the Act for that calendar month, or

if subparagraph (i) does not apply, the first calendar month, after the calendar month in which the family unit forms, for which the family unit is eligible to receive disability assistance under the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (4) (c), the carryover amount for a recipient who is part of a recognized family unit that includes two recipients is calculated as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a recipient who is not designated as a person with disabilities, the product of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the amount specified in paragraph (b) of the definition of "base amount" minus the amount specified in paragraph (a) of that definition, and
12 minus the number of calendar months in the calendar year that are before the initial qualifying month for the recognized family unit;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a recipient who is designated as a person with disabilities, if the last family unit, before the recognized family unit, of which the person was a part that was eligible to receive disability assistance under the Act included no other recipients, the greater of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: nil, and
the exemption limit of that last family unit for the last qualifying month for that last family unit, adjusted as follows:

bcl:clause.bcl:text: by deducting the qualifying income of that last family unit in that last qualifying month;
by deducting the product of

bcl:subclause.bcl:text: the amount specified in paragraph (a) of the definition of "base amount", and
the number of calendar months after that last qualifying month and before the initial qualifying month for the recognized family unit;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a recipient who is designated as a person with disabilities, if paragraph (b) does not apply, the product of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the amount specified in paragraph (a) of the definition of "base amount", and
12 minus the number of calendar months in the calendar year that are before the initial qualifying month for the recognized family unit.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (3) (b), the exemption limit of a family unit for any other qualifying month (an "index qualifying month") for the family unit in the calendar year is the greater of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: nil, and
the exemption limit of the family unit for the last qualifying month for the family unit before the index qualifying month, adjusted as follows:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by deducting the qualifying income of the family unit in that last qualifying month;
in the case of a family unit that includes a recipient whose designation as a person with disabilities was rescinded

bcl:clause.bcl:text: in that last qualifying month, or
in a calendar month after that last qualifying month and before the index qualifying month,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by deducting the product of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the amount specified in paragraph (c) of the definition of "base amount" minus the amount specified in paragraph (b) of that definition, and
12 minus the number of calendar months in the calendar year that are before the index qualifying month;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in the case of a family unit that includes a recipient whose designation as a person with disabilities was made

bcl:clause.bcl:text: in that last qualifying month, or
in a calendar month after that last qualifying month and before the index qualifying month,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by adding the product of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the amount specified in paragraph (c) of the definition of "base amount" minus the amount specified in paragraph (b) of that definition, and
12 minus the number of calendar months in the calendar year that are before the index qualifying month;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by deducting the product of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the base amount for the family unit, as the family is composed in that last calendar month before any rescission described in subparagraph (ii) or designation described in subparagraph (iii) is made, and
the number of calendar months after that last qualifying month and before the index qualifying month.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section and section 5,

bcl:definition.bcl:text: permitted operating expenses means costs, charges and expenses incurred by a person in the operation of a small business, under a self-employment program in which the person is participating, for the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: purchase of supplies and products;
accounting and legal services;
advertising;
taxes, fees, licences and dues incurred in the small business;
business insurance;
charges imposed by a savings institution on an account and interest;
payments, including principal and interest, on a loan that is

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: not greater than the amount contemplated by the recipient's business plan, accepted by the minister under section 70.1 of this regulation, and
received and used for the purposes set out in the business plan;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: maintenance and repairs to equipment;
gross wages paid to employees of the small business, but not including wages paid to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the person participating, or
a person in the family unit of the person participating;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: motor vehicle expenses;
premiums for employment insurance or workers' compensation benefits;
employer contributions for employment insurance, workers' compensation or the Canada Pension Plan;
rent and utilities, excluding rent and utilities for the place of residence of the persons described in subparagraphs (i) or (ii) of paragraph (h) unless

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: there is an increase for rent or utilities and the increase is attributable to the small business, and
the increase is not provided for in the calculation of the family unit's shelter allowance under Schedule A of this regulation;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: office expenses;
equipment purchases or rentals;
contributions made under the Canada Pension Plan in respect of the person's self-employment earnings.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Earned income of a recipient of disability assistance is exempted from the total income of the recipient's family unit if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the recipient is participating in a self-employment program, and
the earned income is derived from operating a small business under the self-employment program in which the recipient is participating and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is used for permitted operating expenses of the small business, or
is deposited in a separate account, established by the recipient in a savings institution, which account

bcl:clause.bcl:text: consists exclusively of funds reserved by the recipient for the purpose of paying permitted operating expenses of that small business, and
the amount deposited does not increase the current balance of the separate account to a sum that exceeds $5 000, or

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is used for costs of renovations to the recipient's place of residence up to but not exceeding $5 000 in total or a greater amount approved by the minister, if the renovations are part of a business plan accepted by the minister under section 70.1 of this regulation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Withdrawals and expenditures from reserve account
bcl:section.bcl:text: The amount of any expenditure or withdrawal out of a separate account described in section 4 (2) (b) (ii) of this Schedule, is earned income for all purposes of this regulation, unless

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the expenditure or withdrawal is for the payment of permitted operating expenses of the small business referred to in section 4 (2) of this Schedule, and

in the case of a withdrawal, the amount withdrawn is used within one month after the date of withdrawal to pay permitted operating expenses of the small business referred to in section 4 (2) (b) (i) of this Schedule.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The only deductions permitted from unearned income are the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: any income tax deducted at source from employment insurance benefits;
essential operating costs of renting self-contained suites.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: disability-related cost means a disability-related cost referred to in paragraph (a), (b), (c) or (e) of the definition of disability-related cost in section 12 (1) [assets held in trust for person with disabilities] of this regulation;
disability-related cost to promote independence means a disability-related cost referred to in paragraph (d) of the definition of disability-related cost in section 12 (1) of this regulation;

intended registered disability savings plan or trust, in relation to a person referred to in section 12.1 (2) [temporary exemption of assets for person with disabilities or person receiving special care] of this regulation, means an asset, received by the person, to which the exemption under that section applies;
structured settlement annuity payment means a payment referred to in subsection (2) (b) (iii) made under the annuity contract referred to in that subsection.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following unearned income is exempt:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the portion of interest from a mortgage on, or agreement for sale of, the family unit's previous place of residence if the interest is required for the amount owing on the purchase or rental of the family unit's current place of residence;
$50 of each monthly Veterans Affairs Canada benefits paid to any person in the family unit;

a criminal injury compensation award or other award, except the amount that would cause the family unit's assets to exceed, at the time the award is received, the limit applicable under section 10 [asset limits] of this regulation;

a payment made from a trust to or on behalf of a person referred to in section 12 (1) [assets held in trust for person with disabilities] of this regulation if the payment is applied exclusively to or used exclusively for

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: disability-related costs,
the acquisition of a family unit's place of residence,
a registered education savings plan, or
a registered disability savings plan;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subject to subsection (2), a structured settlement annuity payment made to a person referred to in section 12 (1) of this regulation if the payment is applied exclusively to or used exclusively for an item referred to in subparagraph (i), (ii), (iii) or (iv) of paragraph (d) of this subsection;

money expended by a person referred to in section 12.1 (2) [temporary exemption of assets for person with disabilities or person receiving special care] of this regulation from an intended registered disability savings plan or trust if the money is applied exclusively to or used exclusively for disability-related costs;
any of the following if applied exclusively to or used exclusively for disability-related costs to promote independence:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a payment made from a trust to or on behalf of a person referred to in section 12 (1) of this regulation;
a structured settlement annuity payment that, subject to subsection (2), is made to a person referred to in section 12 (1) of this regulation;
money expended by a person referred to in section 12.1 (2) of this regulation from an intended registered disability savings plan or trust;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the portion of Canada Pension Plan Benefits that is calculated by the formula (A-B) x C, where

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the gross monthly amount of Canada Pension Plan Benefits received by an applicant or recipient;

in respect of a family unit comprised of a sole applicant or a sole recipient with no dependent children, 1/12 of the amount determined under section 118 (1) (c) of the Income Tax Act (Canada) as adjusted under section 117.1 of that Act, or

in respect of any other family unit, the amount under subparagraph (i), plus 1/12 of the amount resulting from the calculation under section 118 (1) (a) (ii) of the Income Tax Act (Canada) as adjusted under section 117.1 of that Act;
the sum of the percentages of taxable amounts set out under section 117 (2) (a) of the Income Tax Act (Canada) and section 4.1 (1) (a) of the Income Tax Act;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a tax refund;
a benefit paid under section 22, 23 or 23.2 of the Employment Insurance Act (Canada) to any person in the family unit.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) (d.1) and (d.3) (ii) applies in respect of a person only if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person has entered into a settlement agreement with the defendant in relation to a claim for damages in respect of personal injury or death, and
the settlement agreement requires the defendant to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: make periodic payments to the person for a fixed term or the life of the person,
purchase a single premium annuity contract that

bcl:clause.bcl:text: is not assignable, commutable or transferable, and
is designed to produce payments equal to the amounts, and at the times, specified in the settlement agreement,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: make an irrevocable direction to the issuer of the annuity contract to make all payments under that annuity contract directly to the person, and
remain liable to make the payments required by the settlement agreement.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Minister's discretion to exempt education related unearned income

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: day care costs means the difference between a student's actual day care costs and the maximum amount of child care subsidy that is available under the Child Care Subsidy Act to a family unit matching the student's family unit;

education costs, in relation to a student and a program of studies, means the costs, including the costs of tuition, student fees, books, equipment, supplies and transportation, that, in the opinion of the minister, are reasonably required for the student to participate in the program of studies.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may authorize an exemption for a student up to the sum of the student's education costs and day care costs, for a period of study, from the total amount of student financial assistance received by the student for the period of study.
The deductions and exemptions in this Schedule apply only in the calendar month in which the income is actually received, despite any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the date the income is payable;
the period for which the income is payable;
the date the income is reported to the minister;
the date the minister receives notice of the income.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite subsection (1), income that is received before the date that subsection (1) comes into force is subject to the application of section 9 of this regulation as it read immediately before subsection (1) came into force.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Portion of backdated family bonus or Canada child benefit treated as unearned income

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: backdated Canada child benefit payment, in relation to a child benefits cheque, means the portion of the cheque, if any, attributable to the Canada child benefit for one or more calendar months preceding the calendar month in which the cheque is issued;

backdated family bonus payment, in relation to a child benefits cheque, means the portion of the cheque, if any, attributable to the family bonus for one or more calendar months preceding the calendar month in which the cheque is issued;

supplement means a supplement referred to in section 59 [supplement for delayed, suspended or cancelled family bonus] or 59.1 [supplement for delayed, suspended or cancelled Canada child benefit] of this regulation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a person in the applicant's or recipient's family unit receives a backdated family bonus payment or a backdated Canada child benefit payment and all or part of the payment is attributable to one or more calendar months for which the family unit was also provided with a supplement, the lesser of the following amounts must be treated as unearned income:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the portion of the backdated family bonus payment or the backdated Canada child benefit payment, as applicable, that is attributable to those calendar months for which the family unit was provided with a supplement;

the sum of the supplements that are attributable to those calendar months for which the family unit received the backdated family bonus payment or the backdated Canada child benefit payment, as applicable.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (1), an amount that, under the Income Tax Act (British Columbia) or the Income Tax Act (Canada), is deducted or set off from a family bonus or a Canada child benefit is considered to have been paid to a person in the applicant's or recipient's family unit.
Subsection (1) does not apply to an amount included in that portion of a child benefits cheque attributable to family bonus or Canada child benefit

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to replace a lost or stolen cheque for which an amount was advanced under section 58 [advance for lost or stolen family bonus cheque] or 58.1 [advance for lost or stolen child benefits cheque — Canada child benefit] of this regulation, or

to replace a cheque for which no amount was advanced under section 58 [advance for lost or stolen family bonus cheque] or 58.1 [advance for lost or stolen child benefits cheque — Canada child benefit] of this regulation if the replacement is received in the calendar month following the calendar month for which the lost or stolen cheque was issued.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Backdated CPP treated as unearned income

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, pension benefit means a pension or other payment under the Canada Pension Plan (Canada).
If

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: disability assistance is provided to a family unit for a calendar month or any portion of a calendar month that would not have been provided if a pension benefit had been paid for that calendar month, and

subsequently a pension benefit becomes payable or payment of a pension benefit may be made under the Canada Pension Plan (Canada) to a recipient in the family unit for that calendar month or any portion of that calendar month

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the amount of the pension benefit that becomes payable for that month or portion of that month must be treated as unearned income and is considered to have been received by the recipient in that month.

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Schedule:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: audiologist means an audiologist registered with the College of Speech and Hearing Health Professionals of British Columbia established under the Health Professions Act;
basic dental service means a dental service that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if provided by a dentist,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is set out in the Schedule of Fee Allowances — Dentist that is effective September 1, 2017 and is published on the website of the ministry of the minister, and
is provided at the rate set out in that Schedule for the service and the category of person receiving the service,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if provided by a denturist,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is set out in the Schedule of Fee Allowances — Denturist that is effective September 1, 2017 and is published on the website of the ministry of the minister, and
is provided at the rate set out in that Schedule for the service and the category of person receiving the service, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if provided by a dental hygienist,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is set out in the Schedule of Fee Allowances — Dental Hygienist that is effective September 1, 2017 and is published on the website of the ministry of the minister, and
is provided at the rate set out in that Schedule for the service and the category of person receiving the service;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: basic eyewear and repairs means any of the following items that are provided by an optometrist, ophthalmologist or optician:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for a child who has a new prescription, one pair of eye glasses per year consisting of the least expensive appropriate

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: single-vision or bifocal lenses, and
frames;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for any other person who has a new prescription, one pair of eye glasses every 3 years consisting of the least expensive appropriate

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: single-vision or bifocal lenses, and
frames;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for a child or other person,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: new lenses at any time if an optometrist, ophthalmologist or optician confirms a change in refractive status in either eye,
a case for new eye glasses or lenses, and
necessary repairs to lenses or frames that come within this definition;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: change in refractive status means a change of not less than 0.5 dioptres to the spherical or cylinder lens, or a change in axis that equals or exceeds

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 20 degrees for a cylinder lens of 0.5 dioptres or less,
10 degrees for a cylinder lens of more than 0.5 dioptres but not more than 1.0 dioptre, and
3 degrees for a cylinder lens of more than 1.0 dioptre;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: dental hygienist means a dental hygienist registered with the British Columbia College of Oral Health Professionals;
dentist means a dentist registered with the British Columbia College of Oral Health Professionals;
denture services means services and items that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if provided by a dentist

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: are set out under fee numbers 51101 to 51302 in the Schedule of Fee Allowances — Dentist that is effective September 1, 2017 and is published on the website of the ministry of the minister, and
are provided at the rate set out in that Schedule for the service or item and the category of person receiving the service or item, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if provided by a denturist

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: are set out under fee numbers 31310 to 31321 in the Schedule of Fee Allowances — Denturist that is effective September 1, 2017 and is published on the website of the ministry of the minister, and
are provided at the rate set out in that Schedule for the service or item and the category of person receiving the service or item;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: denturist means a denturist registered with the British Columbia College of Oral Health Professionals;
emergency dental service means a dental service necessary for the immediate relief of pain that,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if provided by a dentist,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is set out in the Schedule of Fee Allowances — Emergency Dental — Dentist, that is effective September 1, 2017 and is published on the website of the ministry of the minister, and
is provided at the rate set out in that Schedule for the service and the category of the person receiving the service, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if provided by a denturist,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is set out in the Schedule of Fee Allowances — Emergency Dental — Denturist, that is effective September 1, 2017 and is published on the website of the ministry of the minister, and
is provided at the rate set out in that Schedule for the service and the category of the person receiving the service;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: eye examination means a full diagnostic examination of a person's eyes by an optometrist or an ophthalmologist, that includes

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a determination of the refractive status of the eyes and of the presence of any observed abnormality in the person's visual system,
any necessary tests connected to making determinations under paragraph (a), and
the provision of a written prescription for lenses if necessary;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: hearing instrument has the same meaning as in the Speech and Hearing Health Professionals Regulation, B.C. Reg. 413/2008;

hearing instrument practitioner means a hearing instrument practitioner registered with the College of Speech and Hearing Health Professionals of British Columbia established under the Health Professions Act;
occupational therapist means an occupational therapist registered with the College of Occupational Therapists of British Columbia established under the Health Professions Act;
ophthalmologist means a medical practitioner who practises ophthalmology;
optician means an optician registered with the College of Opticians of British Columbia established under the Health Professions Act;
optometrist means an optometrist registered with the College of Optometrists of British Columbia established under the Health Professions Act;
orthotist means a person who is certified by and in good standing with the Canadian Board for Certification of Prosthetists and Orthotists;
pedorthist means a person who is certified by and in good standing with the College of Pedorthics of Canada;
physical therapist means a physical therapist registered with the College of Physical Therapists of British Columbia established under the Health Professions Act;
physical therapy has the same meaning as in the Physical Therapists Regulation, B.C. Reg. 288/2008;

pre-authorized eyewear and repairs means eyewear and repairs provided by an optometrist, ophthalmologist or optician and for which pre-authorization is given by the minister, but does not include basic eyewear and repairs;

specialist means a medical practitioner recognized as a specialist in a field of medicine or surgery in accordance with the bylaws made by the board for the College of Physicians and Surgeons of British Columbia under section 19 (1) (k.3) and (k.4) of the Health Professions Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following are the health supplements that may be paid for by the minister if provided to a family unit that is eligible under section 62 [general health supplements] of this regulation:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: medical or surgical supplies that are, at the minister's discretion, either disposable or reusable, if the minister is satisfied that all of the following requirements are met:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the supplies are required for one of the following purposes:

bcl:clause.bcl:text: wound care;
ongoing bowel care required due to loss of muscle function;
catheterization;
incontinence;
skin parasite care;
limb circulation care;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the supplies are

bcl:clause.bcl:text: prescribed by a medical practitioner or nurse practitioner,
the least expensive supplies appropriate for the purpose, and
necessary to avoid an imminent and substantial danger to health;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: there are no resources available to the family unit to pay the cost of or obtain the supplies;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the following medical or surgical supplies that are, at the minister's discretion, either disposable or reusable, if the minister is satisfied that all the requirements described in paragraph (a) (ii) and (iii) are met in relation to the supplies:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: lancets;
needles and syringes;
ventilator supplies required for the essential operation or sterilization of a ventilator;
tracheostomy supplies;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: consumable medical supplies, if the minister is satisfied that all of the following requirements are met:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the supplies are required to thicken food;
all the requirements described in paragraph (a) (ii) and (iii) are met in relation to the supplies;
